result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Toni L. Young in court for David M. Willems. Defendant David M. Willems in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Young states that they are looking into veterans court and the DE needs to finish the program he is in.
Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2023 at 10:00 am.

NO RECORD MADE.   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Young.   Clerk. M.Burke. STC set to 10/19/22 at 9:30.

ADDRESS INFO for David M. Willems
Current: 5605 Sheridan Rd, Kenosha, WI 53140-9998 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 6100 24th Avenue #16, Kenosha, WI 53143

Defendant David M. Willems appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  DE motion to modify bond; arguments heard; Court modifies bond to $2000 cash with conditions ( see bond event)    Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
 *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially firearms.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Michael D or Perry H ; Defendant may return to home to collect belongings with a relative.

129PM
  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on  6/10/22 @ 9:30am before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI   Bond is continued. rb
